Today I'm gonna show you
how to convert footage shot

at a standard frame rate
into a high-speed frame rate

using deep learning.
And if you've thought

some of my other videos
were nerdy when it comes to

talking about camera stuff...
Buckle up.
Let's get undone.
[offbeat music]
♪ Gerald Undone ♪
♪ He's crazy ♪

What's happening, everybody,
I'm Gerald Undone, and this...

is the final countdown.
["Final Countdown" opening]

So, NVIDIA has developed
this deep learning interpolation

technique called Super SloMo
that will convert videos

shot at standard frame rates
of 24 or 30 fps

into slow-motion-capable frame
rates like 120 or even 240 fps.

And shout-out to a subscriber,
Noel B,

for suggesting
that I cover this topic.

Now, I'll warn you
right now that this process

is a bit more complicated
than your typical tutorial.

results, because some of them

there's no funny business

stock footage for the test,

so the results
can be repeated by anyone.

is brought to us by

overlays, and even
After Effects templates.

The interface is clean

as you want, wherever you want.
